body.name: ATUMTEK 55" Selfie Stick Tripod, All-in-one Extendable Aluminum Phone Tripod with Rechargeable Bluetooth Remote for iPhone, Samsung, Google, LG, Sony and More, Fitting 4.7-7 inch Smartphones Pink
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 3 hrs 33 mins
features: [All-in-One Multi-functional Design] The ATUMTEK selfie stick tripod combines the functions of a selfie stick and a tripod, allowing users to switch modes freely to meet diverse shooting scenarios.

[Premium Materials and Exquisite Craftsmanship] Crafted with ABS+PC black injection molding technology, the body is not only durable but also visually elegant and sophisticated, making it a top choice for photography enthusiasts.

[Rechargeable Bluetooth 5.0 Remote] The built-in Bluetooth 5.0 remote features a rechargeable lithium battery with USB-C charging, boasting 50mAh capacity for over 20,000 photo captures on a single charge. With a wireless remote range of up to 10 meters, it provides users with a convenient photography experience. It is compatible with Bluetooth versions 3.0 and above on Android 5.0 and iOS 7.0 devices.
[Lightweight and Portable] Weighing only 350g and with a collapsed length of 310mm, the ATUMTEK Selfie Stick Bluetooth is compact and lightweight, ensuring hassle-free photography on the go.

[Wide Compatibility] The phone holder can rotate vertically up to 180° and horizontally up to 360°, supporting both portrait and landscape modes, as well as the newly added overhead mode. The adjustable clamp accommodates phones (from 4.7 to 7 inches) with a minimum width of 56mm and a maximum width of 92mm, ensuring stable and reliable support for smartphones of various sizes and operating systems.
[Comprehensive Protection] The selfie stick is equipped with anti-slip silicone pads, offering full protection to your smartphone and preventing accidental slips or scratches.
[Extended Shooting Range] With its 7-section telescopic design, the stick can extend up to 140cm, allowing users to capture wider angles and expansive views.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: ATUMTEK Bluetooth selfie stick tripod stands out with its quality craftsmanship and stability. Made from high-quality materials, it ensures reliable support and a steady shooting experience. Whether you're outdoors traveling, at a family gathering, or making a Vlog, it is your ideal companion.

Previous page Next page Its light and portable design lets you capture exciting moments anytime, anywhere. The built-in Bluetooth 5.0 remote features a rechargeable lithium battery with USB-C charging. With a wireless remote range of up to 10 meters, it provides users with a convenient photography experience.
Previous page Next page 1 Stable Tripod 2 Versatile Design
Previous page Next page 1 Wide Compatibility 2 Durable Telescopic Arm

Previous page Next page The easy-to-use Bluetooth connection and flexible angle adjustments make shooting even more convenient. Whether you're a photography enthusiast or a regular user, the ATUMTEK Bluetooth Selfie Stick Tripod will enhance your shooting experience.

Play with Color Choose from three stylish colors to match your phone's aesthetics. Whether you prefer classic black, chic white, or vibrant purple, we've got you covered. Explore more Phone Holder for Photography Our versatile and durable smartphone clamp is designed for excellent stability, crafted from premium aluminum alloy. Explore more Rotatable Phone Ring Light - Maximize Creativity The rotation shaft allows you to rotate the ring light a full 180°, providing a better range of angles. Explore more Portable LED Ring Selfie Light for Smartphones With this cute and compact device, you can capture fantastic selfies and videos even in low-light conditions or places without natural light. Explore more Bluetooth Remote Shutter Capture photos from your smartphone at a distance with ATUMTEK's Bluetooth-connected wireless selfie remote. It's a compact-sized remote for your selfies! Explore more Flexible Tripod for Phones & GoPro Our flexible tripod can add a touch of professionalism to any of your videos. Stabilize your footage and say goodbye to shaky content. Explore more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A MUST HAVE TRIPOD FOR A QUICK IPHONE SHOOT, LED LIGHTS, OR A TRAVEL TRIPOD: BANG FOR BUCK!!! 5 STAR
reviews.reviewText: When I first saw this tripod, I thought it would be smaller.I have 10 to 15 of various sizes, being a commercial, photographer, and Podcaster. We had minimal color options, so I chose the baby blue over the pink.After reading the reviews briefly, I did not know what to expect because I had just ordered another tripod from Amazon for around the same price point, and it was highly disappointing because the bottom part was plastic and the top part was metal. It was nowhere near the quality I thought it was going to be.So when I first got this in the mail to pick it up, I was shocked at how big the package wasn't how long it was.Tripods tend to shrink down their small footprint.So when you first get it in your hand, you have to stop and think how this thing unfolds, and that's in a good way because it's a tiny footprint that you can pretty much throw in any bag whether that's traveling or put it somewhere in the corner, but this is a great trip.I am disappointed by my lack of reading correctly, but I thought the tripod legs would be aluminum due to the product description.After figuring out how to open the tripod up, I was shocked by the build quality of the pole, which is lovely aluminum and has a solid feel.I am at McDonald's, grabbing a coffee, and this is where I first took it apart.Once I got the tripod legs down, I was surprised by how big the footprint of the tripod legs was and how long they were.I would compare this base to a lighting setup for an LED light versus a selfie with an iPhone or GoPro.Once you put the base down, it's solid.It can be uneven.Just make sure that you are on a flat surface.What you could also do, which I have done with other tripods, is you can throw like a weight down there and potentially a tiny sandbag to wait for it down a little bit more if you're using this grass or potentially on the sand somewhere.The aluminum base is strong, and it has a great build to it.Again, I've seen tripods from five dollars to $5000One of the first things I did when I opened the package up I didn't realize that this was going to be a 55-inch telescopic brush, aluminum monopod, and that was a good way.After putting it on the ground in front of me, I decided to try my iPhone on there, and then when I went back, I tried a couple of LED lights because they fit in there, depending on how big they were.I did not have a chance to use Bluetooth; however, with the phones now, if you have an Apple watch like I do, you can make a Bluetooth connection to your Apple Watch and take a picture from there, but it is an excellent option that it is a Bluetooth connection.Overall, I give us a 9.5 out of 10 regarding the quality.The only reason why I'm sharing a 9.5 is because I thought the legs were going to be aluminum.The legs were aluminum.I expect a slightly bigger price point, between 30 and $40. Again, I've had multiple tripods across my life.What are the downsides?Going to reach out to the company to see if there are any options to have not just a spring-loaded bracket for an iPhone but also the ability to plug in a 1/4 screw so you could use this potentially with a small camera, perhaps some lights and if it's lower than 55 inches this would be a great light stand that you can use or if you want to have a more miniature DSLR camera that doesn't weigh that much I think it would be a good idea too.Regarding the color, I was on the fence about getting the blue or the pink, but honestly, it doesn't matter to me. I'm so impressed by the tripod that I'm going to be using it on my next photo shoot for a temporary light stand because I'm so used to taking light stands, and this is due to the footprint.I looked at the website, and they have various price points for different types of tripods that range from $42. 99, which is almost a 70-inch selfie stickThose that come with bags which is nice.Also, some of the brackets they have for various types of phone setups. TI have a carbon bracket and a metal phone tripod mount, which looks very high-end.These brackets typically cost between $50 to $200, depending on the CNC manufacturing and looking at it. It is of excellent quality.You have a self-lock on the back &those fourth screws in a cold shoe mount, as I mentioned.If you have any questions, let me know. Still, if you're going to be traveling a lot, doing many product videos, or just doing videos of yourself speaking into a camera, maybe it's going to take you one to two minutes to set up and 1 2 minutes to break down your can't go wrong, and the colors are cute too.YOUTUBE STATEMENT ABOUT REVIEWS AND PHOTOSI'm in the process of setting up my YouTube studio to create product reviews. I plan to post a video review of this product on Amazon shortly.Once the studio is ready, I will upload those videos on YouTube and share them here.I use a Canon R3 camera with various RF lenses to capture professional product shots for my clients. My experience includes commercial photography at conferences, conventions, product shoots, podcasts, motorsports, PGA, MMA, and various events in Experiential Marketing across the USA and Canada.The purpose of creating these video reviews is to help people understand the practical use of the product and how it compares to other products.This will be beneficial for both Amazon and YouTube reviews.TM

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Holds phone securely at any angle.
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Getting this open was a bit of a puzzle, but if you look at both ends, you'll see one is flat, and one has three triangles. Hold the edges of the flat cap, and pull gently. You'll feel the spring, but keep pulling gently until you see the pink plastic phone grip. Pull this a bit more firmly, and you'll see the silver telescoping rod. Grasp the silver part and pull to extend. Before you get too far, pop open the three triangles on the bottom, those are the legs. Then continue to pull the rod, when you get it fully extended, the legs will open. You can then adjust the height of the stand to suit your needs. The head, where the phone goes, is spring loaded so will expand to fit many sizes of phone. I tried an iPhone SE2 and an iPhone 15, and both fit fine, and stayed in place with no slipping or sagging. The stand is stable, even with two dogs racing around it, it didn't jiggle too much, or topple over. The plastic legs are probably the weakest point on this stand. If you tripped over one, or someone backed into it and stepped on it, I suspect they would break pretty easily. That's one of only two things I don't like about this. The supplied bluetooth remote shutter button paired easily (literally took just seconds), and worked perfectly. It's rechargeable using the supplied USB-A to USB-C cable. I'm not too sure about the way it attaches to the stick, however. It snaps into and out of it's little compartment very easily. That's the second thing I'm not thrilled with; the remote does *snap* into it's little compartment, but I think without the tape holding it in place it might pop out and get lost pretty easily. On the whole, it seems well designed and sturdy, and I really like that it collapses into a small tube which can easily go in a large purse, a tote, or a suitcase. I think it's a good addition to my collection of iPhone accessories.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice little tripod
reviews.reviewText: This is a nice little tripod I ordered for my tech challenged father. He likes to take pictures with his phone but always takes them without himself in them. I taught him how to use the timer on this photo app after putting his phone into this tripod. Now he's in way more photos he can show his friends.The tripod is easy to use and stable enough to set on the table.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cute and useful selfie stick
reviews.reviewText: For one, the pink color is very cute and stylish. It also comes with a remote which is very useful. It is also easy to connect to the phone. You just have to turn it on by holding the button and connect it your phone Bluetooth. The remote also has a compartment on the stick that it goes in. You just pop it out when you are ready to use it. I used it for Christmas to take cute holiday pics with boyfriend. I also traveled with it on vacation and it fit well in the suitcase with no issues. As a selfie stick it has great length and you can angle your phone any way you'd like to get the best photos. I also like that this stick doubles up as a tripod for your phone if you are looking to make different videos or create content. If you are an influencer, content creator, or just someone looking for a selfie stick, this is a great choice. The only thing is that I tried to place an external selfie light on the stick/tripod and the weight was causing the tripod to not be as stable and it eventually fell off. SO if you do plan to use a light to add to it, make sure it isn't too heavy in weight.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: Transform Your Photography with the Multifunctional Tripod/Selfie Stick: A Comprehensive Review
reviews.reviewText: In the world of photography, versatility is key, and this tripod/selfie stick hybrid stands out as a game-changer. Measuring just over 12 inches when collapsed, it's the epitome of portability, easily fitting into a bag for on-the-go use. Fully extended, it reaches an impressive height of 135cm (53 inches) as a selfie stick and 137cm as a tripod, catering to a wide range of photography needs.Constructed from sturdy aluminum, this device demonstrates exceptional durability, confidently supporting an iPhone 14 Pro without any signs of flexing. The plastic components, including the phone holder and tripod legs, are surprisingly robust, offering a stable base with no wobble during use.A standout feature is the Bluetooth camera shutter activator, which pairs seamlessly with smartphones, ensuring reliable connection for effortless shooting. The stick's carbon fiber effect finish adds a touch of elegance, enhancing its overall aesthetic appeal.However, this product isn't without its quirks. The unique extension mechanism may initially confuse users, and its considerable weight might deter those seeking ultra-lightweight options. Despite these minor drawbacks, the tripod's solid construction and reliable Bluetooth connectivity make it a valuable tool for photographers and content creators alike.Its limitations in landscape mode and the slightly restrictive height may not suit all users, but for those prioritizing portrait photography and stability, this tripod/selfie stick offers a compelling combination of functionality and design. Whether you're capturing selfies, group shots, or engaging content, this multifunctional device is well worth considering.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hohe Qualität und praktische Funktionen zum kleinen Preis
reviews.reviewText: Der Selfie Stick, den ich getestet habe, hat einen sehr wertigen Eindruck gemacht. Sogar die Verpackung wirkt und fühlt sich hochwertig an. Besonders positiv aufgefallen ist mir, dass der Auslöser bequem per Bluetooth mit dem Handy verbunden werden kann und sich sogar vom Stick abmachen lässt. Dadurch ist er besonders praktisch für Fotos, bei denen niemand hinter der Kamera stehen muss. der Stick wird per USB geladen.Das Handy wird sicher an das Stativ geklemmt und hält sehr fest. Außerdem lässt es sich in der Neigung verstellen, sodass man den perfekten Winkel für die Aufnahme einstellen kann. Ein weiterer Pluspunkt ist, dass der Stick bis zu 140 cm ausgefahren werden kann. Das ermöglicht tolle Perspektiven und erlaubt es, mehr Personen auf einem Selfie unterzubringen. Er kann mit einem Dreifuß abgestellt werden.Alles in allem bietet dieser Selfie Stick ein tolles Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis. Man bekommt sehr viel Produkt für wenig Geld. Ich kann ihn definitiv empfehlen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sehr nützliches stabil stehendes Smartphone Stativ und Selfie-Stick mit Fernbedienung
reviews.reviewText: Das ist die berühmte eierlegende Wollmilchsau.Zum fairen Preis von 32€ bekommt man einen Selfie-Stick, der zudem bis auf 140cm ausziehbar als Stativ nutzbar ist.Ich habe mich zu allerlei Gelegenheiten immer wieder geärgert weil ich irgendwelche Foto- oder Video-Aufnahmen machen wollte und dabei die Aufnahmen verwackelt habe oder ich wollte ein Familienfoto mit dem Smartphone machen und es war keiner da der das Smartphone dafür gehalten hätte.Ich bin kein Selfie-Süchtiger, aber manchmal wäre es schon nice wenn ich von meiner Frau und mir einfach ein Paarfoto im Urlaub machen könnte ohne dafür einen Eingeborenen um Hilfe fragen zu müssen.Diese Probleme haben nun ein Ende.Dieser Sefiestick findet im Urlaub gut Platz in den unendlichen Weiten der Handtasche meiner Frau - die ist wie die Hermine von Harry Potter, die aus ihrer Handtasche Bierbänke und 5 Mann-Zelte zaubert - soviel Platz braucht der ATUMTEK Bluetooth Selfie-Stick allerdings nicht.Dafür lässt er sich auf stattliche 140cm ausziehen, aus dieser Entfernung bekommt man locker 2 Personen auf ein Selfie-Foto incl. Urlaubs-Hintergrund.Da aus Aluminium gefertigt ist es zum Einen sehr leicht und zum Anderen trotzdem nicht so zerbrechlich wie ein Plastikstativ oder Plastik-Selfiestick.Der eigentliche Clou ist das Dreibein-Stativ, das sich am Fuß des Selfie.Sticks befindet.Damit hat man ein sehr stabiles wackelfreies Smartphone-Stativ.Ich habe an Silvester das Stativ aufgebaut, das Smartphone in die Haltebacken geklemmt, dann die Neigungsverstellung der Halterung so eingestellt, dass das Smartphone auf den Horizont und den Nachthimmel ausgerichtet war und hab dann die Smartphone Kamera bequem in 2 Meter Entfernung auf den Gartensessel sitzend mit der integrierten und herausnehmbaren Bluetooth-Kamera gestartet und 20 Minuten Silvester-Feuerwerk aufgenommen und dabei mit den Gästen angestoßen.Klasse Sache.Dann habe ich es einfach gedreht - man kann es um 360 Grad drehen - und uns noch eine halbe Stunde beim Bechern gefilmt.In die neigungsverstellbare Halterung kann man jedes gängige Smartphone und Iphone bombenfest einspannen.Der Atumtek Selfiestick und Stativ ist hervorragend verarbeitet, leicht und vielseitig einsetzbar.Wir können es nur wärmstens empfehlen.

I really enjoy using this selfie stick and phone tripod. My Samsung A50 sits in it well and snug. The clamp can be swivelled into a vertical orientation with the selfie extending pole will be off to the side. The clamp can be adjusted into different angles (tilting it forward or downward).The plastic casing is of decent quality. Probably not for heavy duty use. But for a daily selfie stick/ tripod. Although it does get quite cold in the winter.. not as cold if it was all metal though.The remote charges quite quickly and can be used multiple times. It's easy to turn on and to find and connect on bluetooth. I do wish it was a bit more secure then just little slide on clips, as the remote has fallen a few times when using. Although it hasn't fallen out when in my bag.The telescopic pole is easy to slide out and it stays at the extension (no sliding down from the weight of the phone). The tripod legs are also sturdy and balance the pole well. There are some rubber grips on the feet of the tripod legs for a simple grip. I used the tripod function while doing a timelapse video in a very busy place and it held well.For a dual purpose selfie stick/ phone tripod I do wish it had a few extra features like a wristlet loop or even just a hole to attach your own wristlet strap. It would make it soo much easier to carry around. And perhaps a screw top hole to screw on an external led light. Not that it's required but it would be helpful.Overall I'm quite happy using it and usually have it packed in my purse or backpack (if it's big enough to put it in).
